# Fused Documentation

> Fused is an end-to-end cloud platform for data analytics, built around User Defined Functions (UDFs): Python functions that can be run via HTTPS requests from anywhere, without any install required.

## Core Concepts

- [Call UDFs asynchronously](https://docs.fused.io/core-concepts/async) - A UDF can be called asynchronously using the async/await syntax. A common implementation is to call a UDF multiple times in parallel with different pa...
- [Caching](https://docs.fused.io/core-concepts/cache) - _This pages explains how caching makes Fused more responsive & some best practices for making the best use of it_...
- [Data Ingestion](https://docs.fused.io/core-concepts/generic-data-ingestion) - Fused supports ingesting various data types into your workflows....
- [üê≥ On-prem](https://docs.fused.io/core-concepts/onprem) - Fused offers an on-prem version of the application in a Docker container. The container runs in your computing environment (such as AWS, GCP, or Azure...
- [Why UDFs](https://docs.fused.io/core-concepts/why) - At Fused, our mission is to help get things done, fast. We want every team to be able to get from **Analytics to Action** as quickly as they can. ...
- [Write UDFs](https://docs.fused.io/core-concepts/write) - Follow these steps to write a User Defined Function (UDF)....
- [Build with LLMs](https://docs.fused.io/core-concepts/best-practices/build-with-llms) - _Our mission at Fused is to help you get things done, fast. LLMs can help you write User Defined Functions, then leverage Fused to get feedback on you...
- [Best Practices](https://docs.fused.io/core-concepts/best-practices) - Get the most out of Fused by following these proven best practices for building efficient UDFs, organizing your workflows, and optimizing performance....
- [Making the most out of UDFs](https://docs.fused.io/core-concepts/best-practices/udf-best-practices) - _An opinionated guide to making the most out of Fused UDFs_...
- [Workbench Best Practices](https://docs.fused.io/core-concepts/best-practices/workbench-best-practices) - _Tips & Tricks for making Fused Workbench work for you_...
- [Download](https://docs.fused.io/core-concepts/content-management/download) - Download remote files to the local system to make them available to UDFs across runs. Files are written to a disk shared across all UDFs in an organiz...
- [Environment variables](https://docs.fused.io/core-concepts/content-management/environment-variables) - Save constants to an `.env` file to make them available to UDFs as environment variables. You should use the secrets manager for sensitive information...
- [File systems](https://docs.fused.io/core-concepts/content-management/file-system) - Fused provides two file systems to make files accessible to all UDFs: an S3 bucket and a disk. Access is scoped at the organization level....
- [GitHub Integration](https://docs.fused.io/core-concepts/content-management/git) - Github integration allows you to:...
- [dependencies](https://docs.fused.io/core-concepts/run-udfs/dependencies) - To keep things simple, Fused maintains a single runtime image. This means that any UDF you run will be executed with these dependencies by default...
- [Run UDFs](https://docs.fused.io/core-concepts/run-udfs) - There are 2 main ways to run UDFs:...
- [Batch Jobs](https://docs.fused.io/core-concepts/run-udfs/run_large) - Some UDFs require more resources than a few Gb of RAM or take more than a few seconds to run. For these cases, you can run them as jobs instead....
- [Realtime](https://docs.fused.io/core-concepts/run-udfs/run-small-udfs) - UDFs really shine once you start calling them from anywhere. Realtime is the default way to run UDFs. You can run them in 2 main ways:...
